content: “infinite responsibility, therefore, no rest allowed for any form of good conscience”
man’s life always more than a paradigm, other than a symbol > a proper name (see p. 220 on man) [one should never speak of the assassination of a man as a figure? martydom]
[see SPECTER]
je voudrais apprendre à vivre enfin (I would like to learn to live finally)
is not learning to live experience itself?
the address “I’m going to teach you to live,” from lips of master, father to son > hesitates btwn address as experience, as education, as taming or training (dressage)
[see GHOST]
being-with specters: a politics of memory, inheritance and generations
wisdom “learn-to-live” is ethics itself; learn to live—alone, from oneself, by oneself
to learn-to-live w/ ghosts, in commerce w/out commerce of ghosts

motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

content: questions of the future, “whither?” “where tomorrow?” arrives, proceeds from (provient de) the future, it “exceeds any presence as presence to itself”

no justice w/out principle of some responsibility, beyond all living present, devant les fantômes de ceux qui ne sont pas encore nés ou qui sont déjà morts > possibility provided by “non-contemporaneity with itself of the living present”
Derrida distinguishes here btwn justice & law (not speaking of laws) [see p. 220]
Derrida’s instant, spectral moment, furtive & untimely
to be just: a spectral moment, untimely
alors il y a de l’esprit, des esprits, et il faut compter avec eux > le plus d’un
Kant placed his unconditional dignity (Würdigkeit) higher than any economy

motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

content: justice carries life beyond present life, not toward death but toward “living-on,” a trace where life and death are traces, of traces, a survival that dis-adjusts the identity of the living present, of effectivity

commitment of justice, to whom? to life (natural life, life of spirit) of living being > that this is irrefutable carries justice beyond present life, non pas vers la mort mais vers une sur-vie, where life & death are traces of traces
plus d’un: the horde, crowd, population of ghosts, and also the less than one (moins d’un) of pure and simple dispersion
specter as a foreign guest
haunting marks the very existence of Europe
hantise: obsession, haunting, untimely
haunting is historical, but not dated on a calendar, it’s untimely (intempestive)
flesh disappears in the apparition, dans la venue même du revenant ou le retour du spectre
as soon as one no longer distinguishes spirit from specter, the former assumes a body, incarnates itself, as spirit, in specter > specter an instant of flesh and phenomenality, apparition
what spirit & specter have in common, one doesn’t know if it exists, doesn’t belong to knowledge, almost unnameable thing qui nous regarde
Horatio, third party, witness for Hamlet’s father’s ghost
ghost defies semantics, ontology, psychoanalysis, philosophy

specter takes on the form of someone other (quelqu’un d’autre), that is, a self, subject, person, consciousness, spirit; thus specter is not icon, not ideal, not image of image (Plato’s phantasma), nor simple simulacrum (thought it is so close to this)

asymmetry, we see the ghost of king resembles the king, but can’t see what looks at us, this visor effect linked to everything we will say about specter in general > such is the difference btwn le spectre ou le revenant de l’esprit, fut-ce de l’esprit au sense de fantôme en general > supernatural, paradoxical phenomenology, ungraspable visibility of the invisible, the non-sensuous sensuous of Capital, intangibility of a proper body w/out flesh [see p. 156 are specter/ghost different?]
feel ourselves being looked at by specter acc. absolute anteriority, outside of synchrony
spectral interrupts all specularity, de-synchronizes, calls us to anachrony: we do not see who looks at us
visor effect: “to feel ourselves seen by a look which it will always be impossible to cross” > the inheritance of law
specter in armor, a technical prosthesis, a “blazon of his nobility”

three things which decompose the single thing (spirit, specter, king): 1) mourning, localize, identify the dead, know who and where [ontology, hermeneutics, philosophy] 2) language, voice, “scull had a tongue in it” 3) work, “spirit of the spirit” is work, spirit works
both mask and helmet share the (supreme sign of) power: looking w/out being seen
helmet effect (authority) needs visor effect
mourning ontologizes remains, make them present, name them, localizes the dead
Heidegger’s Being as near to the secret [fixerup—missing source]
after the end of history, a spirit comes by coming back (revenant)
singularity of any first time makes it a last time, repetition, each time it is the event itself: a hauntology
“Oh, Marx’s love for Shakespeare!”

question of the event as question of the ghost: first time (but also last time) & repetition, tout autre > hauntology, logic of haunting: more powerful than ontology, harbors eschatology/teleology as effects, mise en scène pour une fin de l’histoire
what is a ghost? what is effectivity/presence of a specter? > virtuality, ineffectivity, simulacrum? is there a there btwn thing itself & its simulacrum?
what is effective/present about a ghost is its virtuality, ineffectivity

après la fin de l’histoire, l’esprit vient en revenant, il figure à la fois un mort qui revient et un fantôme dont le retour attendu se répète, encore et encore ——follow a ghost, be followed by it, persecuted by very chase we are leading?
question of repetition, specter is always a revenant, can’t control its comings and goings > commence par revenir
no thinker’s lesson more urgent than Marx’s

Marcellus anticipated la venue d’un autre scholar, had to wait several centuries [for Derrida], one who can think possibility of specter, specter as possibility, who can address spirits, who knows that such is the condition of address, mad enough to unlock such a possibility
no future w/out the memory and inheritance of Marx (now that the “dogma machine” is dying out)
Marx incorporated thought of his own irreducible historicity
lucid about political worldwide, about irreducibility of technical, about law, international law, and nationalism
the mark of Marx’s inheritance is undeniable
apocalypse of history, philosophy, Marxism was daily bread for Derrida in ’50s, so those into Fukuyama seem late for the end of history
what happens and deserves the name of an event after the end of history?
good conscience at the end of history: capitalism, liberalism, parliamentary democracy
we are inheritors of plus d’une parole and an injunction (singular) that is disjointed
one always inherits around a secret
the infinite does not inherit
injunction of inheritance “choose and decide from what you inherit,” this choice, like memory, the condition of finitude
one must choose, filter different possibilities of inheritance
the proper of a proper name will always remain to come
Blanchot: we are all subject to Marx, unless failing in everything
“time is out of joint” : both out of order and mad
not a negative, broken time, but a time w/out a certain conjunction

a genius [Shakespeare] operates, it always resists and defies à l’instar d’une chose spectral, “the animated work becomes that thing, the Thing that, like an elusive specter, engineers [s’ingénier] a habitation without proper inhabiting, call it a haunting, of both memory and translation,” “a masterpiece always moves…in the manner of a ghost”
each translation aggravates, seals the inaccessibility to other language
[re: translation of “the time is out of joint”] l’écart: irreducible inadequation to the other language, to stroke of genius of the event that makes the law, to all the virtualities of the original
“time is out of joint” when the inheritor can redress wrongs only by seeking revenge
Austin: a dictionary of words never give a definition, it only gives examples

“[Hamlet] curses his mission: to do justice to a de-mission of time, he swears against a destiny that leads him to do justice for a fault, a fault of time and the times, by rectifying an address, a movement of correction, reparation, restitution, vengeance, revenge, punishment”
when one arrives after the crime [essence of the tragic] one still bears responsibility if only in a self-confession that confesses the other (se confesser en confessant l’autre)
essence of tragic: preorginary and properly spectral anteriority of the crime; Hamlet cursed to be the man of right, can only come after the crime, originarily late and therefore destined to inherit

“one never inherits without coming to terms with [s’expliquer avec (battling with)] some specter, and therefore with more than one specter, with the fault and the injunction of plus d’un” p. 95 deconstruction never been (non) Marxist, faithful to a certain spirit of Marxism > il y en a plus d’un et ils son hétérogènes [this can never be repeated too often (on ne le répétera jamais assez)]

stroke of genius, signature of the Thing “Shakespeare”: authorizes each translation, makes them possible without ever being reducible to them [Derrida is playing w/ the out-of-jointness of each translation of “time is out of joint”] [see p 20]
Hamlet complains that the law stems from vengeance before Nietzsche, before Heidegger, before Benjamin
can we find a rule of cohabitation in a house always haunted rather than inhabited by the meaning of the original?
adjoining—in name, dignity, the just, the right—the gathering up (rassemblement) of oneself, coherence, responsibility > what happens when time is unjust, out of time, ana-chronique?
“time is out of joint” when inheritor can redress wrongs only by seeking revenge
how to distinguish btwn the disjuncture of the unjust and the disjuncture that opens up the infinite asymmetry of the relation to the other, the place for justice?

only “our time,” the epoch, doesn’t happen in anachrony [?], especially when “things aren’t going well” > but, w/ other, isn’t this disjuncture the very possibility for the good, the just, to be announced, possibility of the other?

a justice beyond the economy of repression, not distributive, not calculable equality, outside of the economy of vengeance, incalculability of the gift and singularity, infinite asymmetry, the an-economic ex-position to others

motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

content: “how does the concern w/ what there is to be (qu’il y a à être) [Heidegger] intersect, in order perhaps to exceed it, with the logic of vengeance or right?”
Heidegger on dikē as accord, joining, harmony (Die Fuge (joint) ist der Fug) thought on basis of presence (als Anwesen gedacht) vs. adikia as out of joint (aus der Fuge), error of stupidity
a trajectory without heading, assurance, a trajectory of a precipitation which trembles, vibrates, orients, disorients: the question here addressed to us under the name justice
Heidegger refuses to see nihilism in Ancient Greek thought of adikia, but a “trace” of the “tragic,” beyond esthetic-psychoanalytic, this trace calls us to thinking
Heidegger’s Weile as passage, a transitory moment, time of present that comes from future to the past, toward going of gone
Heidegger especially wants to wrest gift away from spirit of revenge, where people equate the just (das Gerechte) w/ the avenged (das Gerächte)
Heidegger’s thought of joining, jointure, a thinking of injunction

the tragedy of Hamlet cannot be understood if story is reduced to an economy of vengeance, all the hesitations to take revenge, the deliberations, the non-automaticity of the calculations: the neurosis, if you like

[via Heidegger on dikē, on gift w/out debt] heterogeneity of pre-, absolute precedence rendered to singularity of other, irreducible possibility of Un-Fug, anachronic disjointure, what comes before me, as in, comes from the future: the very coming of the event
[Derrida wrestles with Heidegger’s take on dikē, jointure, and its relation to adikia, disjointure or injustice, wondering if he skews the relation in favor of possibility of favor]
Heidegger’s supplement of accord, giving what you don’t have (Plotinus), according presence to the other, beyond economy

motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

content: deconstruction takes shape in thinking gift and undeconstructible justice > always risking evil, expropriation and injustice, only way to render justice to the other as other, the irreducible possibility of Un-Fug

wouldn’t thinking the gift as justice, as what one does not have (Plotinus), and comes back or belongs to the other, risk inscribing “whole movement” of justice in presence, coming into presence? [Heidegger’s gathering]
beyond morality, beyond juridicism, beyond right, w/out calculable insurance against evil > only way to do justice to other as other
irreducible possibility of Un-fug: resource & injunction of reaffirmed affirmation
good conscience loses chance of abyssal desert, “desert in desert,” chaotic desert as open mouth, coming of other (messianic: ineffaceable mark of Marx’s legacy) [see p. 209]
everything Derrida affirms, the “out of joint,” is the possibility of evil, no doubt
despite so many precautions, Heidegger runs risk of reducing justice to juridical-moral rules when he prioritizes gathering to the same over disjunction w/ its cinders
mais sans l’ouverture de cette possibilité, il ne reste, peut-être, au-delà du bien et du mal, que la nécessité du pire, une nécessité qui ne serait (même) pas une fatalité
“time is out of joint” at the moment there is an injunction to swear
“all these words are treacherous” > [spirit, specter, philosophical, ontological?]

the “communism” we will nickname new International: l'alliance d'un rejoindre sans conjoint, sans organisation, sans parti, sans nation, sans État, sans propriété > w/out effacing heterogeneity of the other, sans blesser la dis-jointure [see POOF pp. 54-5]
memories don’t recognize borders btwn ghosts of different generations, revenants pass through walls

deconstruction not taste for void or destruction when aimed at philosophical responses that totalize, deny possibility of the question > but following ethical/political imperative, appeal of thought, injunction itself
differance precipitates absolute singularity, singular because differing
“there is the pledge (il y a le gage),” even before, perhaps, a decision confirms it > responds w/out delay to demand of justice

[MOTHERLOAD] differance (irreducibly required by spacing of any promise) not only (as some believe naively) delay, postponement, retard, but also sans retard, sans délai mais sans présence, in which “here-now” unfurls (déferle), precipitation of absolute singularity (singular because differing, justement), pledge (perhaps before decision), uncompromising, unconditional
differance > se liant nécessairement à la forme de l’instant, dans l’imminence et dans l’urgence: même s’il se porte vers ce qui reste à venir, il y a le gage
Derrida, w/out delay, wants to avoid neutralizing anesthesia of new theoreticism and prevent philosophico-philological return to Marx from prevailing > though it’s necessary too
[re: Blanchot’s “always present” demand] must remain a can-be or a maybe in order to remain a demand, remain urgent

Marx’s 3rd voice, according to Blanchot, is science, but a science that subverts, a science that calls science a radical transformation itself, always in play > Marx “does not formulate this very much”
example [Marx] always carries (porte) beyond itself, opens a testamentary dimension, example is for others, beyond the self
no promise nor injunction w/out disjunction
“multiple” and “at once,” the sign of contradiction w/out contradiction, of non-dialectical or “almost” non-dialectical difference running through every injunction
guarantee of translatability as impossible as the disjunction of untranslatability
the disjunctions btwn Marx’s injunctions were untranslatable even to Marx
deconstruction links an affirmation to the experience of the impossible, radical experience of perhaps
Blanchot: “the scientificity” of science always remains dependent on ideology
how “death of philosophy” induces an excess that keeps philosophy living-on

ends of philosophy, Blanchot: accomplishment of absolute knowledge, its theoretical suppression linked to its practical realization, the nihilist movement in which all values are engulfed, culmination of metaphysics as precursor sign of something else
to announce oneself, is that not to already be there in a way?
opening of the future is its memory (p.45)
no progress of knowledge could saturate the opening which has no knowledge
messianic extremity, eskhaton, exceeds, at each moment, final term of a phusis, such as work, production, and telos of any history
[see MC] Derrida titles text Specters of Marx before he finds specter of communism
no disavowal has managed to get rid of Marx’s ghosts
“Marxism” haunted by what it attempted to foreclose
Hegel’s end of history rung a consonant note w/ many other glas
one part of Marx thought the dividing line btwn ghost and actuality should be crossed, like utopia itself, another tried to believe in dividing line as real limit, conceptual distinction
[time scrambling] threat of specter, no reassuring order of presents, no linear succession of “real time” & “deferred time”
the word conjuration produces a forever errant surplus value, by “capitalizing two orders of semantic value” [?]: 1) secret oath meant to silence 2) magical incantation used to evoke

motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

content: Marx would have played w/ this word if he wrote his Manifesto in French
money, spectralizing disincarnation, not lifeless body, but life w/out individual property, general property of money deprives all personal property (Eigentümlichkeit) of difference
money as ghost [?] a spectralizing disincarnation, a “who,” has a kind of body w/out property
religion, not one ideology among others for Marx
theologizing fetishization of money linked to ideology to religion (to idol or fetish)
Shakespeare understood this phantomalization of property > Marx: little connection btwn money, general form of property, and personal peculiarity (persönlichen Eigentümlichkeit)
becoming-god of gold, at once ghost & idol, a god apprehended by senses
prophet-gravedigger: anything but a humanist
prostitutes of money
money produces a remainder, is but a shadow of a great name
betrayal, perjury, abjuration, lie, simulacrum: never very far from the specter

via Marx, in Timon of Athens [see pp. 96-7 Marx’s play]: Timon’s trust in money (simulacrum, ghost), an oath, a giving credit, to that which is unworthy of oath; not convention society, or law > cult of money as nature, prostitution, thus constant perjury, simulacrum, greed
via Marx, Schein-gold, money (Geld) as origin of spirit (Geist) and avarice (Geiz), transfiguring idealization of commodities: spectropoetic
exchange-value a properly spectral apparition if this figure did not prevent the proper
Marx, like Hegel, hostile toward ghosts, conspires w/ them in order to exorc-analyze their spectrality [see Hamacher Pleorama]
speculation (the hoarder) is always fascinated, bewitched by the specter, devoted in his alchemy to haunting or return of revenants

Marx does not like ghosts, he believes in dividing line btwn ghost and actual reality, living effectivity > he believes enough to want to chase away, exorcise specters > but how to distinguish analysis that denounces magic from a counter-magic?

Marx: “useless metal” of treasure, horde, becomes like burnt-out ashes (ausgebrannte Asche) of circulation, its caput mortuum; miser, speculator: a martyr to exchange value > dreams of pure exchange value
exorcism conjures away evil in ways that are irrational, mystifying, exorcism misleads us w/ respect to its magical, authoritarian dogmatism [unscathed]
“exorcism consists in repeating in the mode of an incantation that the dead man is really dead,” nothing more sure than that what is dead is dead
“this is dead” means I am killing it, I dream of killing, thus: it is alive
“to be present” not un mot d’esprit, but le mot de l’esprit > the first verbal body
pluralize spirit, send a welcome to specters
“an interpretation that transforms what it interprets” contradicts speech act theory and 11th Thesis on Feuerbach
people are afraid of crypto-Marxists, of no longer recognizing “Marxism” [Derrida?]

frontier btwn public & private constantly being displaced because the spacing of the public (techno-tele-discursivity, -iconcity) is neither living nor dead: it spectralizes > less and less assured identity of political
privilege figure of conjuration (Verschwörung, Beschwörung) for another reason [not just fear]: swearing, taking an oath, committing oneself in performative, secret fashion
I accepted address (invitation) “so as not to flee from a responsibility”
[re: dominant discourse on Marxism] the triumphal stage of work of mourning, maniac, jubilatory, animistic magic, rhythm of cadenced march [“Marx is dead,” long live capitalism]

dominant discourse [re: Marxism]: hegemony & “incontestable self-evidence,” testimony, regarding it: 1) public space of testimony: a) political b) mass-media culture c) scholarly, academic culture 2) to speak of dominant “Marxist” discourse is still to speak in Marxist code
Marx rare thinker of past to think originary indissociability of technics and language, tele-technics
position-taking re: Marx and tele-technics [indispensable & insufficient]
have Marx’s heirs helped us think about spectrality? yes and no, we must filter, select
all questions on the subject of being are questions of inheritance, what is to be, what isn’t
by mourning Marxism we inherit it
the most living part of Marxism puts the question of the spectral back “on the drawing board”
techno-mediatic power that conditions and endangers any democracy
“inheritance is never a given, it is always a task”
we can inherit via Marx idea that there’s hegemonic forces represented by dominant rhetoric & ideology w/out supporting his idea of superstructure or (self-)identity of social class
reaction, reactionary, one interpretation of inheritance
for Marx, ultimate support for dominant discourse: identity, self-identity of social class [Derrida believes he can suspend this idea while still inheriting from Marx]
ideologies reduce hiccups to empiricisms
re: these holy alliances, Marxism remains indispensable and structurally insignificant
in the Middle East, war of “appropriation[s] of Jerusalem” [is today the world war] mobilize “the most archaic and most modern spectral forces”
evangelism, good news of alliance of liberal democracy and “free market”
Middle Eastern violence as unleashing of messianic eschatologies, infinite combinatory of holy alliances
Marxism must carry with it a messianic eschatology
“there was never just capital, nor capitalism in the singular, but capitalisms plural”
eschatology of Marxist critique and that of religions cannot accept the epochē of the content, whereas, for deconstruction, it is essential to the messianic
re: Fukuyama’s end of history, a neo-evangelism that allows eschatology of Promised Land to coincide with economic materialism and rationalism of modern sciences
messianicity w/out messianism distinguished from “an idea of” democracy, from law or right, even human rights
Fukuyama follows the Hegel who privileges a “Christian vision”), “end of history” an essentially Christian eschatology
any contradiction would be cancelled
a universal and homogenous state that “rests on the twin pillars of economics and recognition”
in the gospel of politico-economic liberalism (Fukuyama), thinking of the event is most absent in this ideal
Fukuyama’s use of Kant’s regulating Idea
logic of ghost, toward a thinking of event, exceeds binary, dialectical logic where effectivity or actuality (present, empirical, or not) is opposed to ideality (regulating or absolute non-presence)
speed of virtual is real
Fukuyama’s “good news” recognition differentiated from a perverted recognition (Hitler, Stalin) which he calls “megalothymia”
democracy to-come not a future of democracy

undetermined messianic hope, ce rapport eschatologique à l’avenir, at heart of democracy and communism, concept[s] or promise[s] that arise in a diastema (“out of joint”), a “to come” in future present, not a Kantian regulating idea that would retain future modality of the living present
undetermined messianic hope at heart of democratic & communist promise, eschatological relation to to-come of event, singularity, alterity

la démocratie à venir: son “idée” comme événement d’une injonction gagée qui commande de faire venir cela même qui ne se présentera jamais dans la forme de la présence pleine, c’est l’ouverture de cet écart entre une promesse infinie
democracy always untenable because it calls for infinite respect of singularity and infinite alterity as much as respect for calculable, subjectal equality btwn anonymous singularities

w/out experience of the impossible, one might as well give up on justice and the event > this is more honest, giving up on good conscience, might as well confess (avouer)/declare economic calculations/checkpoints (douanes) ethics/hospitality (various messianisms) would still install at border of event (to screen [cribler] arrivant)
hospitality w/out reserve is the condition of the event
Hegel’s not a philosopher of trans-historical man and nature, like Fukuyama claims
Marx is not forthcoming in nature [?]
Fukuyama “responds on demand” [the timely]
triumph of liberal capitalism & its predestined alliance w/ democracy has never been so critical, fragile, threatened
those who oppose simulacrum to presence can’t think event
Derrida refers to being imprisoned in Prague
the latency period, gap, btwn heralded fall of “Marxist” dictatorships & their actual fall could not be represented, calculated, by traditional Marxist discourse and liberal discourse
this is where a new thinking of historicity calls us beyond metaphysical concept of history and end of history, either Hegel’s or Marx’s
[Kojève] “practically,” the “grotesque signature of this sententious verdict”
Kojève: United states as “final stage of Marxist communism,” the end of “out of joint,” an “eternal present,” l’annulation de l’écart btwn desire & need
injunction, pledge, “necessary” promise “il faut l’avenir” marks any opening to the event and conditions interest (not indifference) to anything whatsoever, to all content, no desire w/out it
must/should (devoir) > “necessary’s” 2 forms

instead of reading Kòjeve’s end of history like Fukuyama, as capitalist paradise, Derrida reads an actor’s ploy, a demand that corresponds to law of law: where history comes to an end, historicity of history beings, finally has chance of promising itself
deconstruction had to put into question the onto-theo, archeo-teleological concept of history in Hegel, Marx, “or even” in the epochal thinking of Heidegger

where determined concept of man finished > là l’humanité pure de l’homme, de l’autre homme et de l’homme comme autre commence ou a enfin la chance de s’annoncer—de se promettre > in an inhuman or a-human fashion
Kojèvian Marxism: historicity begins after history
l’épreuve de l’indécidabilitié & “it is necessary” of emancipatory desire > condition of re-politicization, perhaps another concept of political
deconstruction never been (non) Marxist, faithful to a certain spirit of Marxism > il y en a plus d’un et ils son hétérogènes [this can never be repeated too often (on ne le répétera jamais assez)]

“world is going badly (le monde va mal),” il est usé mais son usure ne compte plus, vieillesse ou jeunesse [cf. SW pp. 322-23]—on ne compte plus avec elle, on ne s’en rend plus compte comme d’un seau âge dans le progrès d’une histoire > ce qui arrive arrive à l’âge même > messes w/ “teleological order of history”
cynicism of good conscience, manic disavowal [quotes Allan Bloom]: everything that stood in the way of human dignity has been refuted/buried by history
techno-tele-media apparatuses don’t affect only the facts but concept of “facts”
when politicians become nothing but characters of media’s representation, marionettes, TV actors

regiments of ghosts [the 10 plagues of “new world order” pp. 100-04] have returned camouflaged by archaic symptoms of paramilitary and of postmodern excess of arms (information technology, panoptical surveillance via satellite, nuclear threat)
borders blackened btwn civil & international war, worn down beyond wear (noircissons encore le tableau de cette usure au-delà de l’usure)
suffering that suffers still more when it no longer recognizes itself in old word [“unemployment”] and scene that word named for so long
inter-ethnic wars driven by “a primitive conceptual phantasm of community”

motif.title: SOCIAL / COMMODITY / COMMERCE / MARKET see COMMUNITY

content: local differance donne place et donne lieu, spacing of a displacement gives movement its start, stability, sedentarization depends on it > all national rootedness is in the memory of displacement

archaism, not bad in itself, more outdated than ever in ontopology it supposes, by tele-technic dis-location > this unheard of acceleration no less arch-originary than the archaism it has dislodged (déloge)
not only time “out of joint,” but space in time, spacing [re: ontopology, archaism]
tension btwn international and nation-states
subtitle of SPOM: “the New International” (not necessarily ant-statist)
Derrida admits that the right’s stance on the hypocrisy of what’s called humanitarian should be saluted, while remaining vigilantly on guard for its manipulations
“New International”: untimely link, w/out title, w/out name, contract, w/out party, w/out national community…friendship of an alliance w/out institution

w/out some fidelity to Marxist spirit, the worst, worse than bad, might occur: a fatalist idealism [nihilism, accelerationism] or abstract and dogmatic eschatology in face of world’s evils [orthodox Marxism?] [no re-politicization possible w/out this fidelity]
“fidelity to the inheritance of a certain Marxist spirit would remain a duty”
why is Derrida so late to Marx? he believes in political virtue of contretemps
principle of selectivity guides & hierarchizes “spirits,” fatally excluding in turn, it will annihilate, by watching over some “en veillant (sur) ses ancetres” [dead bodies] and not others
“we” will not please Marxists, insisting on the spirt of Marxism as spirits in the plural and in the sense of specter, allowing untimely specters to come back
must we cite Marx to say “I am Marxist,” “I am not Marxist”?

certain spirit of Marxism., a critique which wants to transform, re-evaluate, self-reinterpret; this spirit distinguished from one that rivets to Marxist doctrine, to “dialectical method,” concepts of labor, social class, etc.
“deconstruction is not a methodical or theoretical procedure,” because it is “never a stranger to the event”
deconstruction beyond critique: insists on “certain emancipatory and messianic affirmation”
promise must promise to be kept (d’être tenue), not to remain “spiritual” or “abstract” but to produce events, effective forms of action
